title: AI-driven pirated manga is booming. Can AI also help curb it?
description: While artificial intelligence is driving the spread of pirated manga online, Japanese government officials are hoping AI can also help rein it in.
content:
When it comes to pirated manga online, which is being produced quicker thanks to artificial intelligence, government officials in Japan are planning to fight fire with fire and use AI to crack down on it.

title: Is AI killing creativity-and is news the first casualty?
description: Artificial intelligence is transforming writing, research, and journalism. Experts warn AI boosts productivity but reduces creativity, diversity of ideas, and originality in news content.
content:

title: AI writes 3 Million lines of code and builds a full web browser in just one week, internet asks does it work
description: Artificial intelligence is improving as we speak. Now, Cursor CEO Michael Trulli has revealed that he got AI to write 3 million lines of code in just a week to build a full web browser. But the internet seems to be a bit sceptical over its functionality.
content: Cursor has skyrocketed in popularity in the past few months as ‘vibe coding’ – using AI to write code – started becoming more useful. Now, Cursor CEO Michael Trulli has revealed that he got AI to make a full web browser within a week with over 3 mill... [2059 chars]

content:

title: AXISCADES subsidiary wins ₹100 crore defence radar contract
description: The operates in aerospace, defence, electronics, semiconductor and artificial intelligence sectors, said the deal positions Mistral as a key player in India’s defence electronics indigenisation efforts
content:

title: Davos 2026: AI not just about creating content, it can predict road crashes too
description: Artificial Intelligence is set to revolutionize road safety. SaveLife Foundation is using AI for predictive analysis to prevent road crashes. The Indian government is also pushing for AI integration in road safety initiatives. AI-trained cameras are already identifying hazards like parked vehicles and intersection conflicts. This technology promises faster insights and can transform lives by making mobility safer for everyone.

title: Want to learn AI and robotics for free? Check out SWAYAM courses
description: The Ministry of Education–run SWAYAM platform has opened fresh registrations for a wide range of free online courses. Learners can enrol from January 19 in subjects spanning animation, artificial intelligence, coding, robotics and cloud computing.
content:
The Study Webs of Active-Learning for Young Aspiring Minds (SWAYAM) will begin fresh registrations for its free online courses from January 19.
